meanings.sent1: The rabbit scooted across the field to escape the fox.
meanings.sent2: She scooted out of the room when she heard her name called.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scooted up the tree when it saw the dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: The children scooted through the playground like a flock of birds.
meanings.sent5: The mouse scooted into its hole before the cat could catch it.

meanings.definition: To go or leave hastily or quickly
meanings.sent1: He scooted away from the argument to avoid getting involved.
meanings.sent2: The students scooted out of the classroom when the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The cat scooted under the bed when it heard the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The car scooted down the street, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent5: The bird scooted off the branch and flew into the sky.
